etymology:
From the verb tanımak "to know, be familiar with"
(compare Old Turkic [script needed] (tanï-, “know, be familiar”), from
Proto-Turkic *tanu- (“to know”).
Cognate with
Azerbaijani tanış,
Kazakh таныс (tanys),
Kyrgyz тааныш (taanış),
Uzbek tanish (“known, acquainted”),
Bashkir таныш (tanış), etc.
